abstract: United States Preventive Services Task Force says it is reasonable for women to seek pap smear tests to prevent cervical cancer every three years instead of every year.
snippet: Pap smear tests are still the best way to prevent cervical cancer, but women should not seek them every year, a government-backed panel and major cancer groups said on Wednesday.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Preventive Services Task Force

lead_paragraph: Pap smear tests are still the best way to prevent cervical cancer, but women should not seek them every year, a government-backed panel and major cancer groups said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Panel Recommends Pap Smear Tests Every Three Years, Not Yearly
headline.print_headline: Panel Recommends Pap Smear Tests Every Three Years, Not Yearly
